SENT.plain: A 32-year-old woman was admitted with a third-degree atrioventricular block
A permanent pacemaker was implanted and the patient was discharged
One week later, the patient presented again with a sustained ventricular tachycardia

Coronary angiography and computed tomography imaging with three-dimensional reconstructions revealed the absence of the proximal part of the right coronary artery (RCA) with a fistula into the pulmonary vein
This is the first case describing an absent proximal RCA combined with a pulmonary vein fistula
